mdRecord.dcterms:title: General orders, no. 143 / War Department, Adjutant General's Office, Washington, May 22, 1863
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: United States. War Department
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Announcement of the formation of a bureau in the Adjutant General's Office to deal with all matters relating to the organization of "Colored Troops." Includes additional regulations on the formation and organization of colored regiments.
Signed, in print, on p. 2: E.D. Townsend, Assistant Adjutant General.
Printed on p. [1]-2 of one folded sheet; p. [3]-[4] are blank.
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Tracy W. McGregor Library. McGregor Endowment Fund, 2001/2002. For additional General orders, 1863, SEE: UB502 .A5 1863.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: United States. Army--African American troops
United States. War Department
United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865--Participation, African American
mdRecord.dcterms:spatial: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
